result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin D Dietz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Carry Concealed Weapon [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Outstanding obligations are not a condition of probation and are to be paid directly to the Menominee Co. Clerk of Court office within 60 days. Debts older than 90 days  will be processed for tax intercept and civil judgments. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Payments plans are available.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Benjamin Dietz in court with atty Matthew Kirkpatrick, Prosecuting atty Scott Niemi appeared for the state,     atty mk filed plea questionarie-no contest plea count 1, fine $1031.25, submit dna sample, 2- fine $265.00, 3- fine $379.00, apply bail bond,  Court advises party of their rights, finds factual basis, accepts defendant's waiver of their rights, the plea made, and finds guilty.
Pre-trial conference on June 13, 2017 at 08:30 am.
